column5: Great stuff Frank, love it!
Great report. I am going in less than 2 weeks!  I can't wait.  Ling are a fantastic fight!
GREAT pictures and nice report....glad to see the Big Nip is producing fish this year...
Great report and pictures Frank, thanks for sharing.

Thanks Harrison. I'm lucky to have such a great woman/fishing buddy in my life.   Hope the info I sent helps, Brian.  I'm sure the two of you would have a fun time.  Thanks, Mike! Good luck!  The two larger ling really scrapped well on our light equipment.   Thanks, Bob.  Lots of small walleye, and decent perch to fill in between bigger fish. Thanks for the compliment, and, the reply to my PM.   Thanks to Jacques for a great explanation on how to use multiquote. MERCI!!!
My pleasure Frankie    Your welcome Any time mon ami
Juli is having way to much fun.  Looks like she out fished you.
She won on biggest walleye, and most perch...I actually landed one more walleye, and, one more ling....but who's counting
Awesome report and pics Frank and Juli  Not only am I getting hungry but jealous aswell
Excellent report.Love the ling shots.  That pink sunrise shot is a beauty!!!!!!  MTP

Anybody that lives in southwestern Ontario that loves to ice fish knows how I've felt so far this winter.....WITHDRAWAL!!!!!!!!!!  Needless to say I've been itching for our annual winter getaway.  This year the destination was Lake Nipissing with hosts Shawn and Terra up at Idle Tyme.  I'm not going to make this a "wordy" report, would rather let the pictures tell the story.  Juli and I had a fantastic time as you can tell by the smiles on our faces.  The fishing was good, consistent enough that we didn't have too many lulls.  If it wasn't walleye biting, we were into perch.  If it wasn't perch, a herring.  Not too mention the thrill of catching our first Ling; Juli had a couple, and I landed three.  Thus the "ugly" in the title.  The pics  Sunday afternoon Juli's first drop of the line, a nice perch    Some "smalleyes"     Juli's beauty walter, we didn't bother measuring to see if it was above the slot. Let her go to spawn and make more of those "Nip" beauties!!     Juli feasting on some perch and walleye    Monday morning sunrise    My first Nipissing herring    Juli's first ever ling coming through the hole    The fight!!     My first Ling, kept this one for our first "freshwater lobster" taste    Juli with a little walleye    Lowrance Lit Up    Juli with another    Tuesday, little 'eye head     My big ling    Another "headshot"    Small ling    The snowstorm Tuesday night     Juli in the snow.  It was blowing in really strong.    Wednesday morning, our home on the ice    Juli's second Ling    Another small eye for the walleye queen    Home away from home, cozy and warm     Don't have any pics, but, we also caught many perch...these were the main course in our nightly fish dinners, along with a few walleyes.  The two of us had a great time, fishing and just getting a nice "battery recharge".  Felt so good to finally hit the hardwater, and, we can't wait to go back to experience "The Nip"!!!!
some fantastic pictures, looks like a great time!
The smiles say it all! Heck, even I have a big grin after reading your post.  Is that last picture of an ice cabin or a cottage????  Thanks for sharing!!

It's a small cottage, that also has two bedrooms and a full four piece bathroom.  Perfect for the two of us. Thanks for the comments, I was grinning going through all the pics making this report.  Forgot to add this one, Ling and melted butter..mmmmmmmmm
Awesome report Frank!
Great report.  I've stayed with Shawn at Idle Tyme at least 4 years ago now and had an excellent time.
She's the Walleye queen indeed! Nipissing doesn't always produce but you guys did very well.  Great report Frank.
Awesome report !!!!!  Those walleyes are beutifully colored. Havent seen them with the stripes on thier backs like that. Looks like an all round great fishing experience. Thanks for sharing.   Paul
Looks like a great get away Frank - glad everything came together for you guys
Looks like a great time for you and the better half.  I'm jealous!!!
Very NICE Juli... but why did you take that Frank guy with you???
Thanks for all the great comments guys!!  Even you, Wayne Special thanks to Dan for the new fishfinder battery, lol!!  She outlasted my old one by a longshot.
Great report, Juli! Ooops, I mean Frankie. Some super pics and I'm sure you'll both think back on this one for years to come. Good stuff!
Well done you two. I can't believe the # of ling caught this year.
My brother and I are on Nipissing this Saturday. I am getting very excited.
Awesome report.!  Looks like you guys had a great time.
Great report, fish and pics Frankie Some much needed R&R for you both and perfect getaway Your smiles say it all!!! Thanks for sharing Jacques
awesome trip nice eyes

Can't figure out how to use the darn multiquote feature, so...  Thanks Roy...we definitely will savour this one for years.  Nipfisher...yeah from what we experienced, and, other reports I've read the ling are plentiful, and, willing.  Plus they are hitting at anytime of day!  Rob...hope the info I sent you helps.  Go get 'em!!!  Jacques...it truly was a well deserved break after many hours spent on the foundation repair, and, basement reno's.  Everyone else...thanks, again!!
awesome fishing trip/report !!!   some very nice pictures too,and a real sweet walleye !!!!
Great Report and nice shots.  You two seem so happy together, awesome!
Excellent report and great fish.  How did the ling taste?  Nice accomodations too

Hey, Joey!  The ling was surprisingly good.  Had heard so much about them, we had to try one.  I cut the meat into cubes, boiled for between 10-12 minutes.  Dipped in melted butter, lobster style, and enjoy. Good meat on the back, and, the tail. The skin is slimy and stinky...similiar odour to a musky, but, the meat is nice white flesh. We would both definitely eat one again.
Awesome report!  Lots of fish and lots of smiles....just the way it should be
Ok,wife just seen this and wants to go. THANKS.  GREAT REPORT
